Accessing microdata

Source: vignettes/accessing-microdata.Rmd
accessing-microdata.Rmd

This package provides basic support for the Census’s new microdata APIs, using the same getCensus() functions used for aggregate data.

Microdata, the individual-level responses, should be used by advanced data users only. Weighting the individual-level responses is required. Please read the microdata API documentation closely.

From the CPS Voting supplement, get data on method of voting using PES1 (Did you vote?) PES5 (Vote in person or by mail?) and PESEX (gender), along with the appropriate weighting variable, PWSSWGT.

# https://api.census.gov/data/2020/cps/voting/nov?get=PES1,PES5,PESEX,PWSSWGT&for=state:01
cps_voting <- getCensus(
    name = "cps/voting/nov",
    vintage = 2020,
    vars = c("PES1", "PES5", "PESEX", "PWSSWGT"),
    region = "state:36")
head(cps_voting)
##   state PES1 PES5 PESEX   PWSSWGT
## 1    36    1    1     1 4571.2161
## 2    36    1    1     2 4806.3694
## 3    36   -1   -1     1 4907.6452
## 4    36   -1   -1     2 5128.4311
## 5    36    1    1     2 3440.3007
## 6    36    1   -3     1 5204.5663

As for all other endpoints, censusapi retrieves the data so that you can perform your own analysis using your methodology of choice. If you’re looking for a simple tool to perform analysis on the microdata, try the data.census.gov microdata interactive tool or the IPUMS online data analysis tool.

Some other ways to access the Census microdata are:

  • Download bulk files from the Census FTP (file-transfer protocol)
  • Retrieve standardized, cleaned microdata data from IPUMS and import with the impumsr package
  • Retrieve microdata via the Census APIs with tidycensus, which has more robust functions for working with this data.

Disclaimer

This product uses the Census Bureau Data API but is not endorsed or certified by the Census Bureau.

Developed by Hannah Recht.
